meanings.sent1: The monk meditated on the dukkha he experienced in life.
meanings.sent2: Buddhists believe in the concept of dukkha as a part of existence.
meanings.sent3: The duck found itself in dukkha when it lost its way in the pond.
meanings.sent4: The weight of the world felt like a heavy dukkha on her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The image of the crying child captured the essence of dukkha.

meanings.definition: The first of the Four Noble Truths in Buddhism.
meanings.sent1: Understanding dukkha is crucial in the teachings of Buddhism.
meanings.sent2: The concept of dukkha is central to the Four Noble Truths.
meanings.sent3: The birthday cake missing candles was a reminder of dukkha.
meanings.sent4: The shadow of sorrow loomed over him like the truth of dukkha.
meanings.sent5: The sunrise symbolized the awakening to the reality of dukkha.
